availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Scott (Christian County, KY, merchant and trader)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, merchant and trader. Kentucky native. Married to Mary J. Greenfield Scott. Father of Burgess Henry Scott, William D. Scott, Mary F. "Fanny" Scott, Sarah "Sally" R. Scott, Walter G. Scott, Bell Scott, Mary Scott, Harry Scott, and Baley Scott. Merchant in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Trader in Christian County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 50B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 682.
Josiah Granville Leach, History of the Bringhurst Family with notes on the Clarkson, DePeyster and Boude Families (Philadelphia, PA: J. B. Lippincott Co., 1901), p. 67.
"W. H. Scott (1818-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial #125047535, accessed February 15, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125047535.
